title: Amulet of unchanging
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Amulet_of_unchanging/zh-CN "Amulet of unchanging/zh-CN")

| " [![Circular amulet.png](/images/8/8b/Circular_amulet.png)](/wiki/File:Circular_amulet.png) |                                                               |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                                                         | amulet of unchanging                                          |
| Appearance                                                                                   | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |
| Base price                                                                                   | 150 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                             |
| Weight                                                                                       | [20](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                                   |

An **amulet of unchanging** is a type of [amulet](/wiki/Amulet "Amulet") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [3.1 Identification](#Identification)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 GruntHack](#GruntHack)
  - [5.3 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [5.5 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [6 See also](#See_also)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

There is a 4.5% chance that a randomly-generated amulet will be an amulet of unchanging, making it the least generated amulet.

## Description

Wearing an amulet of unchanging confers [unchanging](/wiki/Unchanging "Unchanging") and prevents [polymorphing](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") and other means of changing form, including [sliming](/wiki/Sliming "Sliming") but *not* [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning"); a [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") that puts one on while afflicted with sliming will be immediately cured.

If a hero dies while polymorphed (which would normally return you to your normal form) and are wearing an amulet of unchanging, they will instead [die as normal](/wiki/Death_\(character\) "Death (character)") in most cases. The exceptions are listed below, and will return the hero to normal form even if they are wearing the amulet:

- While in the form of a [wood](/wiki/Wood_golem "Wood golem") or [leather golem](/wiki/Leather_golem "Leather golem"), be hit by a [brown pudding](/wiki/Brown_pudding "Brown pudding") bite and rot away.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)
- While in the form of an [iron golem](/wiki/Iron_golem "Iron golem"), be hit by a [rust monster](/wiki/Rust_monster "Rust monster") attack and rust away.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)
- While in the form of a [clay golem](/wiki/Clay_golem "Clay golem"), be hit by the [intrinsic-stealing](/wiki/Intrinsic-stealing "Intrinsic-stealing") attack of a [gremlin](/wiki/Gremlin "Gremlin").[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)
- While in the form of an [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") monster, [pray](/wiki/Pray "Pray") to your [god](/wiki/God "God").

Wearing a cursed amulet of unchanging while in the form of a monster with no [hands](/wiki/Hands "Hands") is considered a major [trouble](/wiki/Trouble "Trouble") by the hero's [god](/wiki/God "God"), and successful [prayer](/wiki/Prayer "Prayer") will uncurse the amulet so they can remove it and eventually return to their base form.

If the hero is polymorphed into a [metallivore](/wiki/Metallivore "Metallivore"), [eating the amulet](/wiki/Eating_jewelry "Eating jewelry") has a 1⁄5 chance of successfully absorbing its magic and "[un-changing](/wiki/Pun "Pun")" them to their normal form.

## Strategy

If discovered early, the amulet of unchanging can be a good substitute for [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") in areas such as the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines") beyond [Minetown](/wiki/Minetown "Minetown"), where [polymorph traps](/wiki/Polymorph_trap "Polymorph trap") are a major obstacle. If you are [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding") and do not have magic resistance, an amulet of unchanging will also protect your steed from polymorph traps. The amulet of unchanging can also suppress unwanted polymorphing from other sources, such as [lycanthropy](/wiki/Lycanthropy "Lycanthropy").

Amulets of unchanging are often used to remain in a particular polymorphed form (usually a powerful one chosen via [polymorph control](/wiki/Polymorph_control "Polymorph control")) for various strategies, with the risk of deaths that occur being permanent where they would not be otherwise - this is especially handy if you lack a reusable source of polymorph. It can also become a literal life-saver if you accidentally [genocide](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide") your role or race while polymorphed.

### Identification

The amulet of unchanging is most reliably identified by wearing the suspected amulet while [eating](/wiki/Eat "Eat") a [mimic](/wiki/Mimic "Mimic") [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse"): the hero will not into a pile of [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold") (or an [orange](/wiki/Orange "Orange") if [hallucinating](/wiki/Hallucinating "Hallucinating")) if the amulet is unchanging and otherwise will not affect their armor as other forms of polymorph do, at worst dismounting the hero from their steed.

For [polyselfless](/wiki/Polyselfless "Polyselfless"), [vegan](/wiki/Vegan "Vegan") and/or [vegetarian](/wiki/Vegetarian "Vegetarian") [conducts](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct"), the best alternative is to polymorph yourself while wearing the suspected amulet and a [ring of polymorph control](/wiki/Ring_of_polymorph_control "Ring of polymorph control"), which allows you to specify a safe form if you do polymorph; if you intend to use a [polytrap](/wiki/Polytrap "Polytrap") for this purpose, you must remove any source of magic resistance as well. If the amulet is unchanging, the polymorph trap will not disappear and you will receive the standard message for a blocked polymorph ("You feel momentarily different").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 43af05a6](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/43af05a6b8bd7fad219d1132170effdeadc02703), if you [improvise](/wiki/Improvise "Improvise") with a [musical instrument](/wiki/Musical_instrument "Musical instrument") and are not [deaf](/wiki/Deaf "Deaf"), you will produce "familiar" music if you have unchanging, providing another way to identify the amulet. The blessed [potion of polymorph](/wiki/Potion_of_polymorph "Potion of polymorph") will also give a controlled polymorph when quaffed.

## History

The amulet of unchanging first appears in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

## Variants

Some variants grant the amulet of unchanging further properties.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), an amulet that is polymorphed into an amulet of unchanging will not revert to its original object like other polymorphed items.

### GruntHack

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), monsters will zap the [wand of polymorph](/wiki/Wand_of_polymorph "Wand of polymorph") at you, making amulets of unchanging and sources of magic resistance much more important to find.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), amulets of unchanging cannot be polymorphed.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), monsters will zap the [wand of polymorph](/wiki/Wand_of_polymorph "Wand of polymorph") at you as in GruntHack, and will throw the [potion of polymorph](/wiki/Potion_of_polymorph "Potion of polymorph") at you as well. The amulet is important to identify and procure in order to prevent this if you cannot find an early source of magic resistance; unlike GruntHack, monsters will refrain from attempting to polymorph you further if they see that it has no effect.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), [doppelganger](/wiki/Doppelganger_\(starting_race\) "Doppelganger (starting race)") [Convicts](/wiki/Convict "Convict") start each game with a cursed amulet of unchanging, which prevents them from polymorphing or [liquid leaping](/wiki/Liquid_leap "Liquid leap") out of the chained [heavy iron ball](/wiki/Heavy_iron_ball "Heavy iron ball") on turn 1. Once removed and uncursed, they can also use the amulet as a means to keep themselves locked into powerful forms (usually obtained from [applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a [mask](/index.php?title=Mask\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Mask (page does not exist)")).

Monsters will zap the wand of polymorph and throw potions of polymorph at you, behaving the same as in EvilHack; the amulet is still a useful source of unchanging to prevent this.

## See also

- [Ring of polymorph control](/wiki/Ring_of_polymorph_control "Ring of polymorph control")

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/mhitu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1458](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mhitu.c#L1458)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/mhitu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1440](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mhitu.c#L1440): *Hit by rusting attack while poly'd*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/mhitu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1537](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mhitu.c#L1537)

*This page is based on a spoiler by [Dylan O'Donnell](https://alt.org/nethack/mirror/www.spod-central.org/%257Epsmith/). The original license is:*

Redistribution, copying, and editing of these spoilers, with or without modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:

1. The original contributors to any spoiler must continue to be credited.
2. Any modifications to the spoiler must be acknowledged and credited.

html:
Amulet of unchanging

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
"
Name amulet of unchanging
Appearance random
Base price 150 zm
Weight 20

An amulet of unchanging is a type of amulet that appears in NetHack.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
    • 3.1 Identification
  • 4 History
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 SLASH'EM
    • 5.2 GruntHack
    • 5.3 UnNetHack
    • 5.4 EvilHack
    • 5.5 Hack'EM
  • 6 See also
  • 7 References

Generation

There is a 4.5% chance that a randomly-generated amulet will be an amulet of unchanging, making it the least generated amulet.

Description

Wearing an amulet of unchanging confers unchanging and prevents polymorphing and other means of changing form, including sliming but not stoning; a hero that puts one on while afflicted with sliming will be immediately cured.

If a hero dies while polymorphed (which would normally return you to your normal form) and are wearing an amulet of unchanging, they will instead die as normal in most cases. The exceptions are listed below, and will return the hero to normal form even if they are wearing the amulet:

  • While in the form of a wood or leather golem, be hit by a brown pudding bite and rot away.[1]
  • While in the form of an iron golem, be hit by a rust monster attack and rust away.[2]
  • While in the form of a clay golem, be hit by the intrinsic-stealing attack of a gremlin.[3]
  • While in the form of an undead monster, pray to your god.

Wearing a cursed amulet of unchanging while in the form of a monster with no hands is considered a major trouble by the hero's god, and successful prayer will uncurse the amulet so they can remove it and eventually return to their base form.

If the hero is polymorphed into a metallivore, eating the amulet has a 1⁄5 chance of successfully absorbing its magic and "un-changing" them to their normal form.

Strategy

If discovered early, the amulet of unchanging can be a good substitute for magic resistance in areas such as the Gnomish Mines beyond Minetown, where polymorph traps are a major obstacle. If you are riding and do not have magic resistance, an amulet of unchanging will also protect your steed from polymorph traps. The amulet of unchanging can also suppress unwanted polymorphing from other sources, such as lycanthropy.

Amulets of unchanging are often used to remain in a particular polymorphed form (usually a powerful one chosen via polymorph control) for various strategies, with the risk of deaths that occur being permanent where they would not be otherwise - this is especially handy if you lack a reusable source of polymorph. It can also become a literal life-saver if you accidentally genocide your role or race while polymorphed.

Identification

The amulet of unchanging is most reliably identified by wearing the suspected amulet while eating a mimic corpse: the hero will not into a pile of gold (or an orange if hallucinating) if the amulet is unchanging and otherwise will not affect their armor as other forms of polymorph do, at worst dismounting the hero from their steed.

For polyselfless, vegan and/or vegetarian conducts, the best alternative is to polymorph yourself while wearing the suspected amulet and a ring of polymorph control, which allows you to specify a safe form if you do polymorph; if you intend to use a polytrap for this purpose, you must remove any source of magic resistance as well. If the amulet is unchanging, the polymorph trap will not disappear and you will receive the standard message for a blocked polymorph ("You feel momentarily different").

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Per commit 43af05a6, if you improvise with a musical instrument and are not deaf, you will produce "familiar" music if you have unchanging, providing another way to identify the amulet. The blessed potion of polymorph will also give a controlled polymorph when quaffed.

History

The amulet of unchanging first appears in NetHack 3.3.0.

Variants

Some variants grant the amulet of unchanging further properties.

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, an amulet that is polymorphed into an amulet of unchanging will not revert to its original object like other polymorphed items.

GruntHack

In GruntHack, monsters will zap the wand of polymorph at you, making amulets of unchanging and sources of magic resistance much more important to find.

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, amulets of unchanging cannot be polymorphed.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, monsters will zap the wand of polymorph at you as in GruntHack, and will throw the potion of polymorph at you as well. The amulet is important to identify and procure in order to prevent this if you cannot find an early source of magic resistance; unlike GruntHack, monsters will refrain from attempting to polymorph you further if they see that it has no effect.

Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, doppelganger Convicts start each game with a cursed amulet of unchanging, which prevents them from polymorphing or liquid leaping out of the chained heavy iron ball on turn 1. Once removed and uncursed, they can also use the amulet as a means to keep themselves locked into powerful forms (usually obtained from applying a mask).

Monsters will zap the wand of polymorph and throw potions of polymorph at you, behaving the same as in EvilHack; the amulet is still a useful source of unchanging to prevent this.

See also

  • Ring of polymorph control

References

  1. ↑ src/mhitu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1458
  2. ↑ src/mhitu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1440: Hit by rusting attack while poly'd
  3. ↑ src/mhitu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1537

{{amulet|name=amulet of unchanging}}
An '''amulet of unchanging''' is a type of [[amulet]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''.

==Generation==
There is a 4.5% chance that a randomly-generated amulet will be an amulet of unchanging, making it the least generated amulet.

==Description==
Wearing an amulet of unchanging confers [[unchanging]] and prevents [[polymorph]]ing and other means of changing form, including [[sliming]] but ''not'' [[stoning]]; a [[hero]] that puts one on while afflicted with sliming will be immediately cured.

If a hero dies while polymorphed (which would normally return you to your normal form) and are wearing an amulet of unchanging, they will instead [[Death (character)|die as normal]] in most cases. The exceptions are listed below, and will return the hero to normal form even if they are wearing the amulet:

* While in the form of a [[wood golem|wood]] or [[leather golem]], be hit by a [[brown pudding]] bite and rot away.{{refsrc|src/mhitu.c|1458|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}
* While in the form of an [[iron golem]], be hit by a [[rust monster]] attack and rust away.{{refsrc|src/mhitu.c|1440|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=Hit by rusting attack while poly'd}}
* While in the form of a [[clay golem]], be hit by the [[intrinsic-stealing]] attack of a [[gremlin]].{{refsrc|src/mhitu.c|1537|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}
* While in the form of an [[undead]] monster, [[pray]] to your [[god]].

Wearing a cursed amulet of unchanging while in the form of a monster with no [[hands]] is considered a major [[trouble]] by the hero's [[god]], and successful [[prayer]] will uncurse the amulet so they can remove it and eventually return to their base form.

If the hero is polymorphed into a [[metallivore]], [[Eating jewelry|eating the amulet]] has a {{frac|5}} chance of successfully absorbing its magic and "[[Pun|un-changing]]" them to their normal form.

==Strategy==
If discovered early, the amulet of unchanging can be a good substitute for [[magic resistance]] in areas such as the [[Gnomish Mines]] beyond [[Minetown]], where [[polymorph trap]]s are a major obstacle. If you are [[riding]] and do not have magic resistance, an amulet of unchanging will also protect your steed from polymorph traps. The amulet of unchanging can also suppress unwanted polymorphing from other sources, such as [[lycanthropy]].

Amulets of unchanging are often used to remain in a particular polymorphed form (usually a powerful one chosen via [[polymorph control]]) for various strategies, with the risk of deaths that occur being permanent where they would not be otherwise - this is especially handy if you lack a reusable source of polymorph. It can also become a literal life-saver if you accidentally [[genocide]] your role or race while polymorphed.

===Identification===
The amulet of unchanging is most reliably identified by wearing the suspected amulet while [[eat]]ing a [[mimic]] [[corpse]]: the hero will not into a pile of [[gold]] (or an [[orange]] if [[hallucinating]]) if the amulet is unchanging and otherwise will not affect their armor as other forms of polymorph do, at worst dismounting the hero from their steed.

For [[polyselfless]], [[vegan]] and/or [[vegetarian]] [[conduct]]s, the best alternative is to polymorph yourself while wearing the suspected amulet and a [[ring of polymorph control]], which allows you to specify a safe form if you do polymorph; if you intend to use a [[polytrap]] for this purpose, you must remove any source of magic resistance as well. If the amulet is unchanging, the polymorph trap will not disappear and you will receive the standard message for a blocked polymorph ("You feel momentarily different").

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|Per {{commit|43af05a6b8bd7fad219d1132170effdeadc02703}}, if you [[improvise]] with a [[musical instrument]] and are not [[deaf]], you will produce "familiar" music if you have unchanging, providing another way to identify the amulet. The blessed [[potion of polymorph]] will also give a controlled polymorph when quaffed.}}

==History==
The amulet of unchanging first appears in [[NetHack 3.3.0]].

==Variants==
Some variants grant the amulet of unchanging further properties.

===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], an amulet that is polymorphed into an amulet of unchanging will not revert to its original object like other polymorphed items.

===GruntHack===
In [[GruntHack]], monsters will zap the [[wand of polymorph]] at you, making amulets of unchanging and sources of magic resistance much more important to find.

===UnNetHack===
In [[UnNetHack]], amulets of unchanging cannot be polymorphed.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], monsters will zap the [[wand of polymorph]] at you as in GruntHack, and will throw the [[potion of polymorph]] at you as well. The amulet is important to identify and procure in order to prevent this if you cannot find an early source of magic resistance; unlike GruntHack, monsters will refrain from attempting to polymorph you further if they see that it has no effect.

===Hack'EM===
In [[Hack'EM]], [[Doppelganger (starting race)|doppelganger]] [[Convict]]s start each game with a cursed amulet of unchanging, which prevents them from polymorphing or [[liquid leap]]ing out of the chained [[heavy iron ball]] on turn 1. Once removed and uncursed, they can also use the amulet as a means to keep themselves locked into powerful forms (usually obtained from [[apply]]ing a [[mask]]).

Monsters will zap the wand of polymorph and throw potions of polymorph at you, behaving the same as in EvilHack; the amulet is still a useful source of unchanging to prevent this.
